text:
$7 nasi padang which I don‚Äôt mind paying but I don think it‚Äôs worth it

The sayur was not bad at first but afterwards seem so so only.

The tauhu goreng is very hard and not much flavour.

The stingray meat is abit mushy and not seem fresh

This place hard to park so I don‚Äôt recommend worth a effort for just average Nasi Padang

Ordered the asam fish, beef rendang, tempeh, and brinjal, plus a drink for around $11.

Loved the tempeh, but the stingray had a fishy, muddy smell that wasn‚Äôt great. Fortunately, the beef rendang and brinjal made up for it‚Äîrich, flavorful, and satisfying.

Please note that Parking is an issue here! Be prepared to walk

I ordered on grab food cos I was craving for sambal goreng. click on it and i saw sambal goreng pengantin. i gave them the benefit of doubt.
Food came in boxes. Smelled good. the moment i put it in my mouth, I was amazed at how delicious it was. Portioning was generous too. A week later I ordered again
same.taste!! VERY CONSISTENT.
So now I know where to look for when I have sambal goreng pengantin fix.
I bought the kuih¬≤. it was also delicious. yummy.
U guys have a new follower.
so sedapppppppppp
5 star. 2 thumbs up
I'll keep coming back.

Early lunch to beat the crowd, paid $24 for 3 similar plates. I would think the price didn't do Justice. You could see the portion of the rice is as big as my Begedel, it's somewhat outrageous. I missed to glance at the cute bowl used to scoop the rice. Parking is a hassle, I would think that their competitor .. PU3 is gonna give them a run for their buck. However I would need to taste the chicken curry at PU3 because the chicken curry here is simply out of this world.. it's a mix of Indian and Malay cuisine.. they've used Malay cooking leaves and Indian spices.. I will judge again after comparing with PU3.

Update:
Revisit them again recently (Oct 2024)
Ordered
1) Mee rebus SGD 3.50
2) Two plate of Nasi Padang
a) Fried egg, chicken wing, sambal goreng, slice potato/wedges SGD 6
B) Omelette, chicken wing, curry vegetable and mutton curry SGD 10
Note: Mutton is soft and easy to tear apart with folks and spoons üëçüèª

Highly recommend their fried chicken and begedil! Begedil is served hot and soft. Very tasty! However, the lady at the cashier wasn‚Äôt friendly at all.
